intro: Dendrocnide caerulea, commonly known as the blue mistflower, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Urticaceae, which includes nettle and related plants. The plant is characterized by its striking blue or purple flowers that bloom in clusters during the spring and summer months. Its leaves are often covered in fine, stinging hairs, a common trait among members of its family. Dendrocnide caerulea is typically found in open woodlands and heathlands, thriving in well-drained soils.
